biography.value:
“A vellum tapestry tears away from its wall mounts, then folds itself into the form of a paper dragon the size of a horse.”

Origami golems are exquisitely crafted from fine textiles, such as paper, vellum, papyrus, or starched silks. Origami golems serve well as hidden sentries, appearing as expensive, but innocuous screens, wall hangings, artwork, or floor-coverings until they attack.

Murderous Masterworks.

Some creators have a more sinister role in mind for the origami golem. These creatures use the golems as assassins, sneaking the creatures into areas where the intended victim will be, or delivering it as a gift. The golems then attack when opportunity allows.

languages.custom: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

description.value: The origami golem makes three Lacerating Strike or Wing Buffet attacks.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 ([[/damage 3d8 + 3 type=slashing]]) damage.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 ([[/damage 3d6 + 3 type=bludgeoning]]) damage, and the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=strength dc=15]] saving throw or be knocked &Reference[condition=prone].

items.name: Wing Buffet (Dragon or Swan Form Only)

effects.name: Wing Buffet (Dragon or Swan Form Only)

description.value: If the golem jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 10 of the golem when it lands must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 33 ([[/damage 6d10 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and is knocked &Reference[condition=prone]. On a success, it takes half the damage and isn't knocked &Reference[condition=prone].

The golem exhales a spray of paper fragments in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ([[/damage 9d6 type=slashing]]) damage and is &Reference[condition=blinded] until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't &Reference[condition=blinded].

The golem emits a trumpeting blast in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ([[/damage 7d8 type=thunder]]) damage and is &Reference[condition=deafened] until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't &Reference[condition=deafened].
The origami golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
While the golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary paper screen, tapestry, or similar flat paper or fabric artwork.
The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, except Fold.
The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
The golem's weapon attacks are magical.
The golem's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

The golem can fold and reshape its papery body to resemble a Large dragon, a Large swan, or a Medium frog. It can use this bonus action again to unfold into a Large, flat piece of decorative fabric or paper. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its unfolded form if it dies.
